definitions: The act of a company reducing the sales of one of its own products as a result of the introduction of another of its products.
The act of a company reducing the market share of one of its products due to the introduction of a new product by the same company.
The act of disassembling a machine or vehicle to use its parts as spare parts for other machines or vehicles.
The act of consuming one's own kind.
examples: The new smartphone model is cannibalizing sales of their older version.
They are cannibalizing parts from old computers to build new ones.
The company fears the new product will end up cannibalizing their existing market.
The predator was cannibalizing its weaker offspring.
